data.title: Actors Who Died in 1990
data.meta_description: Deaths in film & television in 1990. Browse actors, actresses and directors that died in 1990 or search by date or keyword.
data.text:
Charles Boost, Dutch film critic, dies at 82

Alan Hale Jr.

American actor (Skipper-Gilligan's Island), dies of cancer at 68

Ken Hill, American actor (Cobra, Protocol), dies at 49

Arthur Kennedy, American Tony Award-winning stage and screen actor (Death of a Salesman; Fantastic Voyage; Peyton Place; Some Came Running),dies of complications from thyroid cancer at 75

Jan 5 Bart LaRue, American character actor, dies of a heart attack at 57

Hans Jaray, Austrian actor (Lydia, Fedora) and playwright, dies at 83

Jan 6 Ian Charleson, Scottish actor (Gandhi, Chariots of Fire), dies of AIDS at 40

Terry-Thomas [Thomas Terry Hoar-Stevens], English comedian and actor (I'm All Right Jack, Private's Progress), dies of Parkinson's disease at 78

Juliet Berto, screenwriter/actress (Bastienne Bastien), dies at 42

Jan 10 Yvonne Peattie Marquard, actress (Donovan's Reef), dies

Kittens Reichert [Catherine Alma Reichert], American silent screen child actor [House of Cards, Les Misérables], dies at 79

Jan 11 Mary Jane Carr, American actress (Forbidden Trail, Second Wife), dies at 74

David Arkin, American actor (I Love You Alice B Toklas), takes his own life at 49

Gordon Jackson, Scottish actor (Upstairs, Downstairs, The Professionals, The Great Escape), dies after a short illness at 66

Russell "Rusty "Hamer, American actor (Make Room for Daddy - "Rusty"), takes his own life at 52

(Alberto) Semprini, British pianist and radio broadcaster (BBC's Semprini Serenade), dies at 81

Barbara Stanwyck [Ruby Stevens], actress (Big Valley), dies at 82

Madge Bellamy, American actress, dies of heart failure at 90

Alexander Lockwood, American actor (Duel), dies at 87

Ava Gardner

American actress (Barefoot Contessa, On the Beach), dies of pneumonia at 67

Helen Jerome Eddy, American actress (Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm), dies at 92

Joel Fluellen, American actor (Porgy and Bess, Burning Cross, Learning Tree), commits suicide at 82

Whipper Billy Watson

Canadian professional wrestler, dies at 74

Jane Novak, American silent screen actress (Ghost Town), dies of stroke at 94

Feb 6 John Merivale, Canadian-British actor (Caltiki), dies at 72

Ken Lynch, American actor (Paratroop Command, Legend of Tom Dooley), dies at 79

Jean Wallace [Walasek], actress (Big Combo), dies of hemorrhage at 66

Henry Brandon [Heinrich von Kleinbach], German-American character actor (The Searchers; Assault on Precinct 13; Drums of Fu Manchu), dies of a heart attack at 77

Feb 15 Jack Fletcher, American actor (Calucci's Department, Once Upon a Mattress), dies of a heart attack at 68

Erik Rhodes [Ernest Sharpe], American actor (Top Hat, Night at the Ritz), dies of pneumonia at 84

Feb 17 Marc Clement, actor (Career Opportunities, Sluggers Wife), dies at 39

Hulk, fictional character in "Death of Incredible Hulk" on NBC, dies

Stephen Burns, American actor (Casey's Shadow), dies from AIDS complications at 35

Scott Jarvis, American theatrical actor and singer (1776; Here's Where I Belong), dies of AIDS at 48

Fabia Drake, actress (Nice Girl Like Me), dies at 86

Gary Merrill, American actor (Young Dr. Kildare (TV series); All About Eve), dies of a lung cancer at 74

Tom Harmon

American College Football Hall of Fame halfback (Heisman Trophy 1940, Michigan; LA Rams) and broadcaster (CBS 1950-62), dies of a heart attack at 70

Capucine [Germaine Lefebvre], French actress and fashion model (Pink Panther, What's New Pussycat?), commits suicide at 62

Robin Harris, American comedian and actor (House Party, Mo' Better Blues), dies of a heart attack at 36

Maurice Cloche, French film director and screenwriter, dies at 82

René Enriquez, Nicaraguan-American actor (Hill Street Blues - "Ray Calletano"), dies of complications from AIDS at 56

Alice Sapritch, actress (European Vacation), dies

Mar 24 Ray Goulding, American comedian (Bob & Ray), dies of kidney failure at 68

International Chrysis, American Transvestite actor (Q&A), dies of cancer at 38

Helene Fortescu Reynolds, actress (Bermuda Mystery), dies at 65

Aldo Fabrizi, actor (Postman Goes to War, Open City), dies at 85

Katharine Balfour, American actress (Love Story), dies of ALS at 69

Doreen Sloane, English actress (Coronation Street), dies of cancer at 56

Apr 8 Jose De Vega, American actor dies of AIDS at 56

Barbara Miller, British stage and screen actress (Blackadder), dies of a brain tumor at 71

Luis Trenker, South Tyrolean film producer, director and actor (Berge in Flammen), dies at 97

Apr 13 Ronald Ibbs, Irish actor (No Hiding Place, The Saint), dies at 74

Greta Garbo

Swedish actress (Anna Karenina, Camille), dies at 84

Henry Kendrick, American actor (Raising Arizona), dies at 56

Gory Guerrero, Mexican-American professional wrestler, dies at 69

Apr 18 Robert D. Webb, American director and actor (Love Me Tender; The Jackals), dies at 87

Alex McCrindle, Scottish actor (Star Wars, Eye of the Needle), dies at 78

Albert Salmi, American stage and screen character actor (Caddyshack; The Brothers Karamazov; Bus Stop), kills terminally ill wife & self at 62

Apr 22 Bertil Unger, Swedish actor (Devil & Max Devlin), dies at 69

Palmer Deane, actor (Still of the Night), dies

Apr 23 Paulette Goddard, American actress (Modern Times, The Great Dictator, Hazard), dies at 79

Tom Rolfing, actor (He Knows You're Alone, Cliff-Another World), dies

Dexter Gordon, American jazz tenor saxophonist Go!; The Other Side of 'Round Midnight), and actor ('Round Midnight), dies of kidney failure at 67

Sunset Carson [Michael Harrison] American western actor (Cat of Rockies, El Paso Kid, Oregon Trail), dies at 69

David Rappaport, American 3'11' actor (Wizard; LA Law), shoots himself at 38

Charles Farrell, American actor (7th Heaven, My Little Margie), dies at 89

Berta Waterstradt, German writer and actress, dies at 82

May 7 Jessica James, actress (Spring Break), dies of breast cancer at 60

Pauline Frederick, American journalist and author (NBC), dies at 84

Susan Oliver [Charlotte Gercke], American stage and screen actress (Peyton Place - "Ann"; Star Trek - The Cage), television director, and airplane pilot, dies of lung cancer at 58

Franklyn Seales, West Indian-American stage and screen actor (The Onion Field; Silver Spoons - "Dexter"), dies of AIDS at 37

Jim Henson

American puppeteer, artist, screenwriter and filmmaker, and creator of 'the Muppets" (Sesame Street; The Muppet Show), dies of toxic shock syndrome caused by pneumonia at 53

Sammy Davis Jr.

American vaudeville, stage, and screen dancer, singer ("The Candy Man"), actor (Ocean's 11), and Rat Pack member, dies of throat cancer at 64

Jill Ireland, English actress (Carry on Nurse, Family), dies of cancer at 54

Max Wall [Lorimer], British music hall, screen, and stage comic and actor (Professor Wallofski), dies of head injuries from a fall at 82

Max Wall, actor (Jabberwocky), dies

Victor "Vic" Tayback, American actor (Mel Sharples-"Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore "), dies of a heart attack at 60

Joseph Hardy, American character actor (Husbands; The Clock), dies at 71

Eric Barker, actor/writer (Carry on Sergeant, Roommates), dies

Frederick Mellinger, founder of Fredericks of Hollywood, dies at 76

Rex Harrison

English actor (My Fair Lady), dies of cancer at 82

Jun 2 Stuart Hall, actor (Cavalcade, Dawn Patrol), dies

Tom Brown, American actor (Buck Privates Come Home, In Old Chicago), dies from cancer at 77

Jack Gilford, American comedic actor (Save the Tiger, Cocoon, Arthur 2), dies at 81 of stomach cancer

Barbara Baxley, American stage and screen actress and singer (Norma Rae; Nashville; Countdown), dies of a heart attack at 67

Leonard Sachs, British actor (The Good Old Days; John Wesley), dies of kidney failure at 80

Ina Balin, actress (Patsy), dies at 52, of pulmonary hypertension

Anna Palk, actress (Play it Cool, Frozen Dead), dies of cancer at 48

Ludi Claire, American actress, dies at 70

Jim Samuels, comedian, dies of spinal meningitis at 41

Howard Duff, American actor (Flamingo Road, Knots Landing), dies of a heart attack at 76

Onno Molenkamp, Dutch actor (Lifespan, Broken Mirrors, The Lift), dies at 67

Lois Moran Young, American actress (Stella Dallas) dies of cancer at 81

Dallas Alinder, American actor, dies at 58

Jul 14 Philip Leacock, English director and producer, dies of collapsed lungs at 73

Alison Leggatt, British character actress (Day of Triffids, Cows), dies at 86

Jul 15 Margaret Lockwood, British actress (Cast a Dark Shadow, The Lady Vanishes), dies of cirrhosis of the liver at 73

Bernard Cowan, TV announcer, dies of kidney disease at 68

Eddie Quillan, American actor (Mutiny on the Bounty, Julia, Hell Town), dies of cancer at 83

Jul 19 Herbert Nelson, actor (Guilding Light), dies of a stroke at 76

Jul 19 Johnny Wayne, comedian (Wayne & Shuster), dies of cancer at 72

Sara Heyblom, Dutch actress (Obsessions, Pygmalion), dies

Sacha Piteoff, Swiss-French actor and stage director, dies of heart failure at 70

Jul 21 Stanley Shapiro, American screenwriter (Doris Day films), dies of leukemia at 65

Preben Neergaard, Danish actor (Mordskab), dies of cancer at 70

Georges Flamant, actor (La Chienne), dies in Paris at 86

Elizabeth Allan, English actress (Tale of 2 Cities, Camille, Java Head), dies at 80

Jul 27 Nick Pippins, American actor (Simon), dies of AIDS at 35

Jill Esmond, English actress (13 Women, My Pal Wolfe, FP 1), dies at 82

Jul 28 Maurice Braddell, English actor (Things to Come), dies at 89

Edwin Richfield, British actor (Interpol Calling, The Avengers), dies at 68

Charles Arnt, actor (Double Exposure), dies of pancreatic cancer at 82

Aug 6 Gordon Metcalfe, American actor (Monster in the Closet), dies of AIDS at 43

Eva Sully Block, American vaudeville actress (Kid Millions), dies of heart failure at 88

Dorothy Appleby, American actress (Small Town Boy, Paradise Express), dies at 84

Dorothy Mackaill, British-American actress (Love Affair), dies of kidney failure at 87

Aug 12 Sara Seegar [Stone], actor (Mystery of Room 13), dies at 76

Jimmy Starr, American screenwriter, actor (The Corpse Came C.O.D.), and gossip columnist, dies at 86

Nina Bara [Frances Bauer], Argentinian actress (Missile to the Moon, Space Patrol), dies of cancer at 70

Pat O'Connor, New Zealand professional wrestler (b. 1925)

Pearl Bailey, American Tony and Emmy Award-winning stage and screen actress, singer and dancer (Hello, Dolly!), dies of a heart attack at 72

Aug 17 Roderick Cook, English actor (Rockabye), dies of apparent heart attack at 58

Raf Reymen, Flemish actor (Huisvuil, Het glas water), dies at 64

Merlin Marston, American actor (Blue Sky), dies of non-Hodgkins lymphoma at 46

Raymond St Jacques, American actor, director and producer, who was the 1st African-American to hold a regular role in a western series (Simon Blake in "Rawhide"), dies of cancer at 60

Irene Dunne

American actress (Cimarron, Theodora Goes Wild), dies of heart failure at 91

Beppo Brem, German actor (Frontgockel), dies of heart failure at 84

Ben Frank, American actor (Don't Answer the Phone), dies of a heart attack at 56

Athene Seyler, English actress (Make Mine Mink), dies at 101

Jackie Moran, American actor (Janie, Barefoot Boy), dies of cancer at 65

Jay Currin, stuntman/actor (Back to the Beach, Serial), dies at 34

Matvey Isaakovich Blanter, Russian-Soviet composer of popular songs and film music ("Katyusha"), dies at 87

Avis Bunnage, British actress (Rising Damp, Coronation Street), dies at 67

Oct 4 Jill Bennett, British actress (Lady Jane, Concrete Jungle), overdoses at 58

Richard Murdoch, actor (Lilli Marlene), dies of a heart attack at 83

Carlos Thompson, actor (Mistress of the World), dies at 67

Douglas Edwards, American newscaster (CBS Evening News, FYI), dies of cancer at 73

Oct 11 Robert Tessier, actor (Nightwish, Future Force), dies at 56

Max Tailleur, Dutch adjudant to Prince Bernhard and Jewish humorist, dies at 81

Hans Freudenthal, German-Dutch mathematician and director (OW&OC), dies at 85

Delphine Seyrig, French actress (Freak Orlando, Reperages), dies of lung disease at 58

Joel McCrea, American actor (Foreign Correspondent, Sullivan's Travels), dies of pulmonary complications at 84

William Samuel Paley, American president and CEO of CBS (1928-90), dies of a heart attack at 89

Jacques Demy, French film director and screenwriter (Lola; The Umbrellas of Cherbourg; Donkey Skin), dies of AIDS at 59

Oct 27 Ugo Tognazzi, Italian comedy actor, director and screenwriter (La Cage Aux Folles, The Tragedy of a Ridiculous Man), dies of a brain hemorrhage at 68

Harry Lauter, American actor (Escape from the Planet of the Apes, Waterfront), dies of heart failure at 76

Mary Martin

American actress (Peter Pan) and Larry Hagman's mom, dies of cancer at 76

Sashadhar Mukherjee, Indian film producer (Jagrit), dies at 81

Nov 3 Valerie French, British actress (Jubal), dies of leukemia at 62

Herbert Berghof, Austrian actor (Belarus File, Harry and Tonto, Target), dies of heart failure at 81

Will Kuluva, American actor (To Trap a Spy, Go Naked in World), dies at 73

Josephine Wilson, British actress (The Lady Vanishes, We Dive at Dawn), dies at 86

Grampy Davis, American actor, dies of a heart attack at 87

Ronnie Dyson, American stage actor (Hair - "Aquarius"; Salvation), and soul singer ("(If You Let Me Make Love to You Then) Why Can't I Touch You?"; "I Don't Wanna Cry"), dies of heart failure at 40

Alexis Minotis [Alexandros Minotakis], Greek actor (The Merchant of Venice; King Lear), dies at 90

Nov 11 Lisa Kirk, American Broadway singer and actress (Kiss Me Kate), dies of lung cancer at 65

Dave Willock, American actor (Queen of Outer Space), dies at 81

Nov 12 Eve Arden [Eunice Quedens], American stage and screen actress (Stage Door; Our Miss Brooks; The Mothers-In-Law; Grease), dies at 82

Bill E Herndon, actor (Rivals), dies at 54

Dean Hart, Canadian professional wrestler (b. 1954)

David White, American actor (Larry Tate-Bewitched), dies of a heart attack at 74

Tamara De Treaux, actress (ET), dies at 31

Robert Gordon, American child actor (billed as "Bobby" - The Jazz Singer; Mountains of Manhattan), and director (The Joe Louis Story), dies at 77

Robert Cummings, American actor (Love that Bob, Dial M For Murder), dies of kidney failure at 80

Gavin Reed, actor (Body Beneath), dies at 59

Edward Binns, American actor (12 Angry Men; Fail-Safe), dies of a heart attack at 74

Horst Bienek, German writer and director (The First Polka), dies at 60

Dec 7 Jean Duceppe, Quebec actor (Mon oncle Antoine), dies at 67

Dec 7 Joan Bennett, American actress (House Across the Bay), dies at 80

Martin Ritt, American actor and director (The Spy Who Came In from the Cold, Slugger's Wife, End of the Game), dies at 76

Mike Mazurki, Austrian-American actor and professional wrestler (Some Like It Hot, It's a Mad Mad Mad Mad World), dies at 82

Hope Sansberry, American actress (Rats are Coming), dies at 94

Betty Warren, British actress (Passport to Pimlico), dies at 83

Dec 15 Jean Paige, American silent film actress (Capt Blood; Black Beauty), dies at 95

Don Draper, American actor (Pepper Agent 00X), dies of AIDS at 61

Dec 17 Mieke Verstraete [Maria Augustina De Graef], Belgian-Dutch actress (Pleasantly Settled), dies at 79

Anne Revere, actress (National Velvet), dies of pneumonia at 87

Basil Henson, actor (Change Partners), dies of stroke at 71

Helene Stanley, American actress (Carnival Story, Roar of the Crowd),and live-action model for Disney animators (Cinderealla; Sleeping Beauty), dies at 61

Kiel Martin, American actor (Hill Street Blues - "Det. LaRue"), dies of cancer at 46

Dalton Cathey, American actor dies of AIDS at 44
